text: The sixty-fourth note (also called a hemidemisemiquaver or semidemisemiquaver) is a note with a value of of a whole note which is where it gets its name. It has four flags or beams. In the \frac 4 4 time signature it has a value of of a beat. It is the shortest common note in musical notation ==References== * * * "The listener is right to suspect a Baroque reference when a double-dotted rhythmic gesture and semihemidemisemiquaver triplets appear to ornament the theme" (112). * Category:Note values
title: Sixty-fourth note
